Package project2

Class ArrayHeap

java.lang.Object
project2.ArrayHeap
public class ArrayHeap
extends java.lang.Object
This class is a Heap that is implemented using an ArrayList. This class has one field arrayheap: which is an ArrayList that stores tickets. A heap is a type of complete binary tree and it fulfills the following properties: Every level but the lowest has all possible nodes. The entry in a node is greater than the entries of its children. If the lowest level isn't full, all nodes are as far left as possible. In this case the root of the ArrayHeap is always the ticket with the highest rank.
Author:
Sahara Karima Mosin Rahimani

  • Method Details

    • heapifyUp

      public void heapifyUp()
      This method pushes a ticket upward to reestablish the heap property

    • heapifyDown

      public void heapifyDown()
      This method pushes a ticket downward to reestablish the heap property

    • add

      public boolean add​(project2.ticket tix)
      This method adds tickets in the next available position in the arrayheap and heapifies upward as needed to restore the heap property.
      Parameters:
      tix - is the ticket that will be added to the arrayheap
      Returns:
      true after the ticket is added to the arrayheap

    • removeMax

      public int removeMax()
      Removes the root(ticket with highest ranking) from the ArrayHeap and replace it with the last leaf or ticket. The new root is then heapified downward if needed.
      Returns:
      the rank of the previous root that was removed

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      This method checks if the ArrayList is empty, it does this by checking if the size of the ArrayList is 0.
      Returns:
      it returns a boolean if it is empty it returns true, if it is not empty it returns false.

    • rankAt

      public int rankAt​(int index)
      This method gets the rank in a specific position or index of the ArrayList
      Parameters:
      index - is the position in which the rank is
      Returns:
      rank of the ticket in the position that was entered

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      This is a simple toString for easy printing
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      a string with all the information of each ticket in arrayheap if the arrayheap is empty it shows a message that states "Empty ArrayHeap!"
